Issues.Title: [master] Update dependencies from dotnet/core-setup
Issues.Body:
This pull request updates the following dependencies

- **Build**: 20190410.11
- **Date Produced**: 4/11/2019 2:16 AM
- **Commit**: fc83d21e68eda29caa99c9864750f7c8d273a378

- **Updates**:

## Coherency Updates

The following updates ensure that dependencies with a *CoherentParentDependency*
attribute were produced in a build used as input to the parent dependency's build.
See [Dependency Description Format](https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/blob/master/Documentation/DependencyDescriptionFormat.md#dependency-description-overview)

- **Microsoft.Win32.Registry** -> 4.6.0-preview5.19210.8 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)
- **System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager** -> 4.6.0-preview5.19210.8 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)
- **System.Drawing.Common** -> 4.6.0-preview5.19210.8 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)
- **Microsoft.Win32.SystemEvents** -> 4.6.0-preview5.19210.8 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)

- **System.Security.Permissions** -> 4.6.0-preview5.19210.8 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)
- **System.Windows.Extensions** -> 4.6.0-preview5.19210.8 (parent: Microsoft.NETCore.App)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[master] Update dependencies from dotnet/core-setup" (#745)

Issues.Title: Consolidate HandleCollector code
Issues.Body:
- Move duplicate code to `Common/src/Interop/Interop.HandleCollector` (matching .NET Core interop guidelines)
- Consolidate `CommonHandles`
- Update namespaces as a result
- Preparation for consolidating code between `SafeNativeMethods`, `UnsafeNativeMethods`, `IntSafeNativeMethods`, `IntUnsafeNativeMethods`, `NativeMethods` etc etc
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Consolidate HandleCollector code" (#744)

Issues.Title: Add System.Windows.Forms.Design tests and fix bugs/debug asserts
Issues.Body:
Fixes #734
Fixes #736
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR " Add System.Windows.Forms.Design tests and fix bugs/debug asserts" (#737)

Issues.Title: new DesignerActionMethodItem(null, ...).Invoke throws NRE but should return "can't find method"
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "new DesignerActionMethodItem(null, ...).Invoke throws NRE but should return "can't find method"" (#736)

Issues.Title: CodeDomSerializerException throws NRE for null exceptions
Issues.Body: Should work!
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "CodeDomSerializerException throws NRE for null exceptions" (#734)

Issues.Title: [Discussion] Should we remove some documentation-style summary docs
Issues.Body:
E.g. In ExpressionContext.cs

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1275900/55875112-1d803000-5b8c-11e9-8d6b-0e4382c6cf4a.png)

I don't think this adds anything to the code as it just duplicates the online docs. Should we remove things like this where it doesn't add any value in explaining what the code does?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Discussion] Should we remove some documentation-style summary docs" (#733)

Issues.Title: Onboard on async publishing
Issues.Body:
Relates to: https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/issues/2443

Goal: mitigate `lock on the feed problem` and add further validations. [More details here.](https://github.com/dotnet/arcade/blob/master/Documentation/CorePackages/AsyncPublishing_HowToUse.md)

Test build was here: https://dnceng.visualstudio.com/internal/_build/results?buildId=149725
Test release: https://dnceng.visualstudio.com/internal/_apps/hub/ms.vss-releaseManagement-web.cd-release-progress?_a=release-pipeline-progress&releaseId=4446
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Onboard on async publishing" (#732)

Issues.Body: Should use `0`

Issues.Title: Create tests for ported components for DevExpress
Issues.Body:
We have ported several components from framework to core. These components were lack of unit tests and during the porting process we agreed to create only minimal unit tests to keep the process faster and unblock the customers porting process as soon as possible.

These components need more through unit tests to be added.

Related issue: #221 

Portability report available: https://microsoft-my.sharepoint.com/:x:/r/personal/dreddy_microsoft_com/_layouts/15/Doc.aspx?sourcedoc={1b3ac7ac-3792-4bcc-8d58-8185fa1d1557}&action=edit&activeCell=%27Details%27!B76&wdInitialSession=b95b5c5e-57b6-47cc-88ff-5ca14cbb4182&wdRldC=1
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Create tests for ported components for DevExpress" (#716)

Issues.Title: WinForms ComboBox SelectedIndexChanged event behaves inconsistently
Issues.Body:
If the SelectedIndex property is set programatically, the event does not fire unless {new value <> old value}. However, if the user accesses the drop-down and selects an item (via the GUI), the event always fires (even in the case where the new value is the same as the old value).

Looking at the reference source, this can be traced to the fact that WmReflectCommand always calls OnSelectedIndexChanged() when processing CBN_SELCHANGE, but the SelectedIndex property setter compares old and new values before doing anything.

It's not 100% clear that this is a bug (there is some sense in working the way it does), but it is definitely misleading and should be documented if this behavior is by design.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WinForms ComboBox SelectedIndexChanged event behaves inconsistently" (#730)
